channel.title: Teleport Tab help
channel.description:
Hey..
Im making a really good stable server..
But u know on DeltaScape Source
U got ''PK ZONE"
With under:
- Which Wild Zone -
Varrock PK Edgeville Mage bank
I wanna do the same on ''Home'' Teleport
with: - Home - Shops - Donator Zone
But idk how to do that. I tryied to do it.
But didn't work for me.
Hope anyone can help me.
Greetz
PhoenixZone

item.title: Teleport Tab help
item.dc:creator: @faze1one faze1one
item.description:
@faze1one wrote:

[quote=“tman915, post:10, topic:323774”]im stuck too.
i changed the name of my teleports. mage bank to catherby skills/varrock to party room. but when i click them it teles me to the original location.[/quote]

thats cus you have to change the coordinates

item.title: Teleport Tab help
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Use these methods to show the options, then add the actions for them within case 9157 and 9158 of the clickingMost class:

[code] /**
* Displays a dialogue for the player to select an option.
* @param question The question that will be displayed on the dialogue.
* @param option1 The first option to be displayed.
* @param option2 The second option to be displayed.
*/
public void showOptions(String question, String option1, String option2) {
sendFrame171(1, 2465);
sendFrame171(0, 2468);
sendFrame126(question, 2460);
sendFrame126(option1, 2461);
sendFrame126(optoin2, 2462);
sendFrame164(2459);
}

/**
 * Displays a dialogue for the player to select an option.
 * @param question The question that will be displayed on the dialogue.
 * @param option1 The first option to be displayed.
 * @param option2 The second option to be displayed.
 * @param option3 The third option to be displayed.
 */
public void showOptions(String question, String option1, String option2, String option3) {
	sendFrame126(question, 2470);
	sendFrame126(option1, 2471);
	sendFrame126(option2, 2472);
	sendFrame126(option3, 2473);
	sendFrame164(2469);
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport Tab help

item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

You need to edit only the clickingMost class, I believe. The text shown is also handled in that class.
